Properties of Materials

All materials have certain properties, including;

  • Transparency (0-100%)
  • Color (hex code)
  • Special Properties
  • Global Rarity
  • Malleability (Rated 1+)
  • Viscosity (rated 0+)
  • Reactivity (rated 0-100)
  • Weight (0+)
  • Fragility (Rated 0-100. Solids only)

Properties

  • Transparency (0-100%).
  • Color (?) The color and texture of the material and the items produced from it.
  • Special Properties (This includes the effects different specifications of materials have. It also includes the associations such materials have- the connections and repulsions to the schools of magic and their bases)
  • Global Rarity. % of items in the world that this material should account for. The closer to a set maximum value the current quantity gets the harder it is to get that material through production.

Solid

  • Malleability (Rated 1 or greater). Any value below 101 is solid. (100 =gold, lead). For crafts which deal with manipulating the shape of objects (blacksmithing, carpentry, tailoring) the value 101-Malleability is applied as a penalty to crafting checks dealing with that item. This does not generally apply to Cooking or Herbalism checks, however.
  • Fragility (Rated 0-100.) This indicates the brittleness or general liklihood of the material to break rather than deform. A material of greater than 100 Malleability must have a fragility of 0, while a less Malleable substance must have a 1 or greater fragility.
  • Rigidity (1-100) Items with rigidity of less than 50 generally are worked with by tailors. Rigidity greater than 50 are generally worked with by blacksmiths and carpenters.
  • Viscosity (rated 0+) Solids generally have a viscosity of 0.
  • Reactivity (rated 0-100) This is the chance a component will activate chemically in some way.
  • Weight Generally, the Malleability, Fragility, and Weight of materials are closely related for solid materials (items with Fragility > 0 and Malleability < 101) the Weight is usually {10*Malleability}/Fragility. Weight for a liquid (Malleability 101-200) is generally 100/{Malleability-100}. Weight for a gas (Malleability 201+) is generally 1/Malleability.

Liquid

  • Malleability Any value above 100 is liquid.
  • Viscosity (rated 0+) Liquid Viscosity is generally 1-200
  • Reactivity (rated 0-100) This is the chance a component will activate chemically in some way.
  • Weight. Weight for a liquid (Malleability 101-200) is generally 100/{Malleability-100}.

Gas

  • Malleability. Any value above 200 is gas.
  • Viscosity (rated 0+) Gasses generally have a viscosity of no lower than 201.
  • Reactivity (rated 0-100) This is the chance a component will activate chemically in some way.
  • Weight. Weight for a gas (Malleability 201+) is generally 1/Malleability.

Special Properties

All modifiers that apply are included. The value of many modifiers is proportional to the quantity of that material in the object relative to other materials. For example, the leather wrapping on a sword's handle has less effect than the metal from which the blade is constructed.
